title: New telephone installed and checked out

note: No dial tone. Called for repair from neighbor’s house at 12:30 p.m. Repairman refastened loose connection at box at 5:30 p.m.
title: Tried to call out at 10:00 a.m

note: taking out both the power and phone services for about 3 h.
title: Returned from a weekend vacation. The neighbors said that while we were gone an automobile had knocked down the telephone pole on our corner

note: Line was repaired on 15 November at about 5:30 p.m.
title: Arose at 6:00 a.m. to discover that an overnight ice storm had snapped the line into the house overnight
Dropped the handset and broke the earpiece about 11:30 a.m
Heavy wind and rainstorm. Branch from a tree blew down across our house lines about 1:30 p.m., breaking
Same problem with fast busys at 8:00 a.m

note: Unit replaced at 4:12 p.m. by a repairman who suggests that punching the keys harder does not make them work better.
title: At 1:00 p.m. keypad on the telephone stops working; punching keys does not send tones
Phone off-hook again. Replaced at 10:00 a.m. Was able to call out by 10:20 a.m

note: Thursday, 20 November Another big ice storm. Lines down all over the area.
title: Tried to make call. Line was ‘‘dead’’ for no apparent reason. Tried again 5 min later and got out OK
Lines into the house OK, but could not get dial tone between 2:00 p.m
